Description:
LOCATION.... IDEAL INVESTMENT or 1ST HOME
One of 6 in a lovely quiet street in popular Kennington is a comfortable two bedroom unit. Suitable for investors, first home or retirees. Both bedrooms have BIR's. Kitchen with gas stove and pantry, a three piece bathroom and plenty of storage. Gas heating and reverse cycle cooling. Brand new carpet and vinyl throughout. Lovely private backyard. Ideal position close to Strath Village Shopping Precinct, schools, public transport.
Sandi Dixon : 0418337275

Description:
Classic meets modern in exceptional location
An impressive refurbishment has wholly refreshed this classic Californian bungalow, allowing it to once again extend a warm welcome to residents and visitors alike. Complemented by a wealth of original features, modern additions have been harmoniously infused to meet all expectations for modern living. Leadlight windows, timber fretwork and Baltic pine floors continue to grace the interior beneath 11 foot ceilings. Gas heating and evaporative cooling, however, are now ducted throughout for ultimate comfort. Aptly taking centre stage, a clawfoot tub stands like an elegant artwork in the bathroom. Fine provincial style cabinetry in the kitchen, topped with hardwood benches, host stainless-steel appliances. Ever emitting their inviting ambience, open fireplaces with stunning timber mantles have been retained in both the lounge and dining rooms. Three large bedrooms include main with direct bathroom access, as well as French doors to the extensive, covered and elevated rear deck. An exquisite summer oasis, the big backyard also features lofty and long-established shade trees, along with extensive red brick paving and secure fencing. Potential to sub-divide the backyard to create a unit site exists (STCA), due to the generous dimensions of the block that measures approximately 744 square metres. With the CBD, university, shopping centres, buses, schools, parks and more all an easy stroll away, you hardly need a car living here. This prized location, plus vacant possession available or the option of an excellent tenant staying on, just add to the many reasons why you need to book an inspection of this exceptional property as soon as possible.
Paul Byrne : 0439 441 198

Description:
Quiet & Private Location
In sought-after Kennington, this appealing 3 bedroom home has new carpet & lino & has been freshly painted inside & out. A bright lounge room at the front has decorative ceiling & cornices with a gas heater & a wall-mounted air-conditioner. The bright kitchen features plenty of storage, a side-by-side gas oven & cooktop & room for a dining setting. All 3 bedrooms are a good size & share a 3 piece bathroom that would make a great renovation project. There's a laundry off the kitchen & a separate toilet just inside the back door. Outside you have a lovely backyard with undercover entertaining; a single carport & shed provide plenty of room for off-street parking. Leading from the carport to the house is a brick-paved arbour with a flowering creeper. Investors, downsizers & others will be charmed by this home. Alternatively you could consider subdividing STCA.
Luke Goggin Real Estate - "We Get Results"

Description:
Quiet Location - Solid Family Home
THIS 80s-style residence has been a family home for more than 30 years, and being such a well-built and maintained property, it's sure to serve its new owner just as well.
The location is simply superb. Ridgeway Crescent is a quiet family thoroughfare just a few minutes' walk from both the university and BSE College to the south, and a similar distance to Kennington Reservoir and the shopping precinct in the east.
As an investment, this area of Bendigo is a sure bet, and when you consider that this home also has an upstairs extension with its own bathroom and private access, then the proximity to the university is even more attractive.
This very solid home is all original, and while you might want to update the dcor, the bones of this property are solid.
In the lounge room, cathedral ceilings feature, with exposed beams, a solid-brick feature wall, gas heating and an archway leading to the meals area and kitchen.
The cabinetry is all hard-wearing solid timber with updated appliances that include a Westinghouse electric wall oven, Chef gas cooktop, and an as-new Bellissimo dishwasher.
All three bedrooms have built-in wardrobes and ceiling fans, and evaporative air-conditioning is ducted throughout. A second heater at the end of the hallway keeps all the bedrooms cosy in winter.
The upstairs area also has reverse-cycle heating and cooling.
Outside is a very generous backyard with shade trees, a rainwater tank, and a steel garden shed.
A single-car garage with roller door provides secure off-street parking. The owners say the neighbours are wonderful too, which is icing on the cake at this brilliant location.
Insights: 8 Ridgeway Crescent, KENNINGTON VIC 3550 was last sold in 2015 and 26 other 4 bedroom house in KENNINGTON have recently been sold.

ORIGINAL MINERS COTTAGE

A real piece of history.

Description:
QUIET STREET - RENOVATED HOME
Looking for a new angle? This home has just that point of difference to make life interesting.
Situated on a street in sought-after Kennington, this three-bedroom weatherboard takes advantage of a very gentle bend in the road to sit on the site at a slight angle.
Its floor-plan capitalises on the angles, with an L-shaped wing housing two bedrooms, both with good-sized built-in wardrobes. There's a sunny third bedroom/sunroom at the rear.
The bathroom and kitchen are recently renovated, and the house is freshly painted with new floor coverings.
The living space has been opened up to provide a good family entertainment area off the spacious kitchen. A second big living room provides flexibility, making this an adaptable home. It opens on to the sunroom through double doors.
There's a carport, through to the 10x6 lock up garage which also has power, with an under-cover barbeque area alongside.
There's nothing to do in this well-maintained home but with its flexible spaces and functional layout there's plenty of scope, too, for it to adapt.
Insights: 13 Mahon Avenue, KENNINGTON VIC 3550 was last sold in 2015 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in KENNINGTON have recently been sold.

Description:
Iconic California Bungalow Family Home
Only minutes to everything our beautiful city has to offer is this well admired and popular looking solid brick California Bungalow.
Sited at the foot and outskirts of Central Bendigo, on the fringe of the McIvor Road end of Sternberg Street, this truly unique family home has been loved and cared for over many years.
On an untouched genuine 1/4 acre (approx. 1009m2)block, its multipurpose potential will attract a variety of buyers.
Original in areas with loads of potential to modernise, extend or develop (STCA), the home offers 3 bedrooms and study (or formal dining) and 3 living areas.
Evident from the front portico and through the double glass doors, original features grace the home and include leadlight windows, decorative ceiling roses and cornice work, and open fire places and chimneys.
Heating and cooling is available, plus the modest kitchen overlooks an open plan meals/family room which has an outlook of the massive rear yard.
Upstairs you will find a huge loft-style rumpus room for the kids.
Outside are established and secure gardens, shedding with power and secluded alfresco areas, all so close to popular amenities.
Seize the moment and call this iconic home yours.
Nekti Tzouroutis : 0412 242 321
Insights: 7 Sternberg Street, KENNINGTON VIC 3550 was last sold in 2014 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in KENNINGTON have recently been sold.

Description:
GREAT POTENTIAL IN QUIET COURT
With views of the city, is this well-kept 3 bedroom home in a prized position, bordering Strathdale, in the heart of Kennington. The elevated allotment welcomes you with veranda, well established & low maintenance garden. The solid brick home has been designed & built with quality & integrity, this you can see is evident throughout the home, providing a great feel & warmth! 3 large bedrooms, master with ensuite, the second & third have built in robes. There is a great 3 piece family bathroom and a modern & well-appointed Blackwood kitchen. Additional features include high ceilings, exposed brick, open plan kitchen & meals area, ducted gas heating & evaporative cooling. The outside patio area is well designed, with gas BBQ connected, ready for entertaining. Also featuring a double carport, with workshop & storage. This is a rare offering, inspect today!

Description:
FABULOUS LOCATION - BACKING TO KENNINGTON OVAL
Looking for a project? Then have a look at this 2 bedroom aluminium clad home, sited on approx 676 square metres, in one of the best Kennington locations.
Backing onto the Kennington Oval, one block away from St Therese's Primary School, in the zone for Bendigo South East Secondary school and a hop, skip and a jump away from the doctor and chemist.
All this adds up to an amazing location to live. So perhaps you may like to consider the idea of further subdividing (subject to council approval) and building 2 townhouses in such a handy spot.
Apart from that, the 2 bedroom home is neat and tidy, with tenants paying $250 per week.

Description:
LIGHT & BRIGHT SPACIOUS UNIT
Quietly set back from Marnie Road, with excellent proximity to the contemporary Kennington Village shops and cafes, as well as recreation facilities at your doorstep, this unit is a stand out. Comprising of two bedrooms, the layout features open plan living with natural light. The master is quite big & each room contains built in robes. Comfort is assured with heating & cooling. The open plan kitchen is well appointed, with a meals area. Full bathroom and a rear backyard that is much larger than you would expect. You will feel secluded whilst still being amongst the hustle and bustle which Kennington has to offer. Also features a single car garage, this unit will not last long in today's low interest rate market.

Description:
SPOTLESS 2 BEDROOM RESIDENCE IN QUIET KENNINGTON LOCATION
Situated just off St Aidens Road close to Strath Hill shopping and the new Woolworths complex, University, schools and the recreational walks around the picturesque Kennington reservoir. Description:
An Opportunity not to be Missed!
Perfectly positioned in a classic location is this 3 bedroom weatherboard home, sited on 630m2 (approx) block. The home has been restumped & reroofed, with new floating timber floors in the kitchen & lounge area, so a lot of the hard work has already been completed, allowing you to simply move in now or continue to renovate/extend (STCA) first.
Ducted floor heating throughout and gas log fire in the lounge, plus kitchen with gas hot plates & overhead cupboards.
Outside there's an undercover alfresco & small shed, plus a long single carport.
This property is within walking distance to the CBD, schools and some of the best recreational facilities around town.

Description:
This is really a No Brainer - Perfect in Every Way
Location is always a key in any Real Estate transaction, so look no further than this perfectly presented, 3 bedroom cream brick home in the heart of Kennington.
The home is quaint but also appealing in many ways, with fresh updates literally throughout the inside and the outside.
All 3 bedrooms have built-in robes and the kitchen has all mod cons including gas hot plates, electric under-bench oven, dishwasher and rangehood, plus ample cupboards and bench space.
Separate lounge with polished floorboards, ducted heating and cooling throughout and a bathroom that compliments itself in presentation.
Outside you will find a massive alfresco undercover deck area to entertain family and friends, established gardens both front and rear, great shedding with concrete floor and 3 phase power, and a double carport with freshly laid asphalt.
This lovely home is within walking distance to Bendigo's newest shopping centre Kennington Village, Strath Village, Strath Hill, schools, doctors, bus and recreational facilities. This has to be the best value in Kennington by far.
Nekti Tzouroutis : 0412 242 321

Description:
Remarkably Charming Victorian
A prestigious suburb, an expansive street, and neighbouring houses all exuding character & style. A wrought iron embellished verandah sets the scene for this fine Victorian home as you walk in to be greeted by a charming hallway boasting with stunning high ceiling and architraves - a feature that continues throughout the home. The master bedroom is sizeable with lovely polished boards, picturesque frontage windows, built in robes and spectacular period ensuite. A grand proportioned lounge with original fire place, bedrooms two & three are a great size, up to date main bathroom, you'll further find a remarkable kitchen and dining area cleverly designed to enhance space & light while respecting the original architecture. Quality appliances fit out the kitchen which overlooks a quaint outdoor courtyard, while neatly tucked away and leading to rear access is the separate laundry which leads you to an ideal undercover entertaining with open fire place and spa bath. Great heating and cooling options, private corner block with fantastic established gardens, single garage plus single carport. Take this opportunity to secure your charming Victorian family home within walking distance to Bendigo itself.

Description:
JUST OFF STEANE STREET - QUIET LOCATION
Majestically set at the end of a very wide driveway,
sits this very spacious unit offering picture window in the lounge-dining room, evaporative cooling, perfect to keep you cool during the Summer months. Separate kitchen with lots of cupboards, 2 roomy bedrooms, both with built in robes and a separate bathroom, with bath, vanity and shower. There's plenty of storage as well. Carport with roller door, and separate tool shed. All walking distance to Coles McIvor Road. First time available in 10 years.
Make your home here!

Description:
LOVE THE HOME AND THE LOCATION
The home was built in the 1970's, having had some changes made along the way, it is still a great a family home as it was back then! There is so much to love. Located in the prime Kennington precinct where great properties on large allotments are few and far between. Sitting perched on a block with lovely views and only a few minutes from the centre of Bendigo. Offering a split level floor plan which includes three large spacious bedrooms, the main has ensuite and spa with built in robes. The modern kitchen is well appointed and accessed from the fantastic lounge area, with adjoining dining, plus a generous second rumpus or living area. Outside you have a stunning front deck area, with built in BBQ and sun umbrella, perfect for relaxing and entertaining. The rear yard is exciting with plenty of space, in addition to an undercover entertaining area, including another BBQ. The extra-long double garage has plenty of space for the cars plus workshop and storage.
This attractive opportunity is in an ideal location. Call today for a closer inspection as it will suit several buyers needs!
Andrew Pearce : 0419 544
251

Description:
THE BEST OF BOTH WORLDS
This large majestic home is currently being used for business purposes but could be transformed back into a beautiful family home with period style features rarely found these days. On a large corner allotment of approx. 1/4 acre, this could be the property that you have been searching for. Whether you wish to retain as business premises (S.T.C.A.) or live in, you have the “best of both worlds”. The floor plan can be easily adapted for family living. The ultimate home could comprise 4 bedrooms plus separate study, two living areas, separate bathroom, additional wheelchair accessible toilet/laundry and kitchen with 900 mm hot plates and oven. Ducted evaporative cooling assists to keep the whole property cool while several gas heaters and split system air conditioners allow individual rooms to be kept at a constant temperature. Don't look past this fantastic location close to the CBD, schools, parks and shops. Single carport and a large shade sail allow outdoor entertaining your friends will be jealous. Please call for a personal inspection.
Andrew Pearce : 0419 544
251
